conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the image to understand the setup of the wire frame and the magnetic field, then apply electromagnetism principles.
The image shows a square wire frame with side length \( L \), half inside a uniform magnetic field directed into the plane, with a capacitor of capacitance \( C \).
The area of the square wire frame is \( L^2 \).
The change in magnetic flux \( \Delta \Phi \) through the frame is \( \Delta \Phi = k \cdot L^2 \).
The induced electromotive force \( \Delta \mathcal{E} \) in the loop is \( \Delta \mathcal{E} = k \cdot L^2 \).
The current \( I \) in the loop can be found using \( I = \frac{\Delta \mathcal{E}}{R} \).
Assuming \( R = 1 \), the current \( I = k \cdot L^2 \).
The magnitude of the induced electromotive force is \( \Delta \mathcal{E} = k \cdot L^2 \).
The current in the loop is \( k \cdot L^2 \), and the magnitude of the induced electromotive force is \( k \cdot L^2 \).
